column1: {{c1::Itália, Itáliae}} has gender {{c2::f}} and means {{c3::Italy}} with English derivatives {{c1::italics, italicize}}
{{c1::memória, memóriae}} has gender {{c2::f}} and means {{c3::memory, recollection}} with English derivatives {{c1::memoir, memorial, memorize, memorandum, commemorate}}
{{c1::tempéstās, tempestā́tis}} has gender {{c2::f}} and means {{c3::period of time, season; weather, storm}} with English derivatives {{c1::tempest, tempestuous; cf. tempus}}
{{c1::(pl) mī́lia, mī́lium}} has gender {{c2::n}} and means {{c3::thousands}}
{{c1::centum}} is a/an {{c4::indeclinable adj}} and means {{c3::one hundred}}
{{c1::tertius decimus, tertia decima, tertium decimum}} means {{c3::thirteenth}}
{{c1::quārtus decimus, quārta decima, quārtum decimum}} means {{c3::fourteenth}}
{{c1::quīntus decimus, quīnta decima, quīntum decimum}} means {{c3::fifteenth}}
{{c1::sextus decimus, sexta decima, sextum decimum}} means {{c3::sixteenth}}
{{c1::septimus decimus, septima decima, septimum decimum}} means {{c3::seventeenth}}
{{c1::vīcēsimus prīmus, vīcēsima prīma, vīcēsimum prīmum}} means {{c3::twentieth}}
{{c1::centēsimus prīmus, centēsima prīma, centēsimum prīmum}} means {{c3::hundred and first}}
{{c1::bis mīllēsimus, bis (?) mīllēsima, bis (?) mīllēsimum}} means {{c3::two thousandth}}
{{c1::míser, mísera, míserum}} means {{c3::wretched, miserable, unfortunate}} with English derivatives {{c1::misery, commiserate}}
{{c1::ínter}} is a/an {{c4::prep+acc}} and means {{c3::between, among}} with English derivatives {{c1::intern, internal; common as Eng. prefix, e.g. interact, intercept, interdict}}
{{c1::ítaqaue}} is a/an {{c4::adv}} and means {{c3::and so, therefore}}
{{c1::commítto, commíttere, commī́sī, commíssum}} means {{c3::to entrust, commit}} with English derivatives {{c1::committee, commission, commissary, commitment, noncommissioned, noncom}}
{{c1::exspéctō, exspectā́re, exspectā́vi, exspectā́tum}} means {{c3::to look for, expect, await}} with English derivatives {{c1::expectant, expectation}}

{{c1::iáciō, iácere, iḗcī, iáctum}} means {{c3::to throw, hurl}} with English derivatives {{c1::abject, adjective, conjecture, dejected, eject, inject, interject, object, project, reject, subject, trajectory}}
{{c1::ēiciō, ēicere, ēiēcī, ēiectum}} means {{c3::to throw out, drive out}} with English derivatives {{c1::cf iaciō, iacere}}
{{c1::tímeō, timḗre, tímuī}} means {{c3::to fear, be afraid (of)}} with English derivatives {{c1::timid, timorous, intimidate; cf. timor}}
Irregular adjective: duo . {{c1::duo: M N nom pl; N acc pl::gender(s) case(s) number(s) for macron(s)}}
Irregular adjective: duae . {{c1::duae: F nom pl::gender(s) case(s) number(s) for macron(s)}}
Irregular adjective: duorum . {{c1::duōrum: M N gen pl::gender(s) case(s) number(s) for macron(s)}}
Irregular adjective: duarum . {{c1::duārum: F gen pl::gender(s) case(s) number(s) for macron(s)}}
Irregular adjective: duobus . {{c1::duōbus: M N dat or abl pl::gender(s) case(s) number(s) for macron(s)}}
Irregular adjective: duabus . {{c1::duābus: F dat or abl pl::gender(s) case(s) number(s) for macron(s)}}
Irregular adjective: duos . {{c1::duōs: M acc pl::gender(s) case(s) number(s) for macron(s)}}
Irregular adjective: duas . {{c1::duās: F acc pl::gender(s) case(s) number(s) for macron(s)}}
Irregular adjective: tres . {{c1::trēs: M or F nom or acc pl::gender(s) case(s) number(s) for macron(s)}}
Irregular adjective: tria . {{c1::tria: N nom or acc pl::gender(s) case(s) number(s) for macron(s)}}
Irregular adjective: trium . {{c1::trium: M F or N gen pl::gender(s) case(s) number(s) for macron(s)}}
Irregular adjective: tribus . {{c1::tribus: M F or N dat or abl pl::gender(s) case(s) number(s) for macron(s)}}

genitive case use: of the whole/partitive . {{c1::used without preposition 1) to indicate the whole after a word designating a part of that whole, 2) after nom and acc of certain pronouns and adjectives; potentially as a neuter substantive adjective . 1) "of" 2) without preposition::how to recognize . translation}} .

genitive case use: {{c1::of the whole/partitive::genitive of ___}} . used without preposition 1) to indicate the whole after a word designating a part of that whole, 2) after nom and acc of certain pronouns and adjectives; potentially as a neuter substantive adjective . {{c1::1) "of" 2) without preposition::translation}} .

genitive case use: {{c1::of the whole/partitive . used without preposition 1) to indicate the whole after a word designating a part of that whole, 2) after nom and acc of certain pronouns and adjectives; potentially as a neuter substantive adjective::genitive of ___ . how to recognize}} . 1) "of" 2) without preposition .

ablative case use: of cardinal numbers . {{c1::expressing the idea of the whole after "ex" or "dē", itself after 1) a cardinal number (other than mīlia), 2) quīdam, 3) (sometimes) paucī . "of"::how to recognize . translation}} .

ablative case use: {{c1::of cardinal numbers::ablative of ___}} . expressing the idea of the whole after "ex" or "dē", itself after 1) a cardinal number (other than mīlia), 2) quīdam, 3) (sometimes) paucī . {{c1::"of"::translation}} .

ablative case use: {{c1::of cardinal numbers . expressing the idea of the whole after "ex" or "dē", itself after 1) a cardinal number (other than mīlia), 2) quīdam, 3) (sometimes) paucī::ablative of ___ . how to recognize}} . "of" .

ablative case use: of time when/within which . {{c1::used without preposition indicating the time when or within which . "at," "on," "in," or "within," but NOT, "for."::how to recognize . translation}} .

ablative case use: {{c1::of time when/within which::ablative of ___}} . used without preposition indicating the time when or within which . {{c1::"at," "on," "in," or "within," but NOT, "for."::translation}} .

ablative case use: {{c1::of time when/within which . used without preposition indicating the time when or within which::ablative of ___ . how to recognize}} . "at," "on," "in," or "within," but NOT, "for." .
The adjectives and pronouns with which the genitive of the whole are used are: {{c1::mīlia, aliquid, quid}}, {{c2::multum, plūs, minus}}, {{c3::satis, nihil, tantum, quantum}}.
